newsitem.title: FINLAND: FINNISH ELCOTEQ TO GET ESTONIA INVESTMENT AWARD.
newsitem.headline: FINNISH ELCOTEQ TO GET ESTONIA INVESTMENT AWARD.

text.p: Finnish electronics group Elcoteq is to recieve an award as the best investor in Estonia for 1996, the Estonian privatisation agency told Reuters at a Baltic investment conference here.
Kulliki Linnamagi, foreign relations manager for the agency, said an award ceremony would take place in Tallinn tomorrow and will be attended by President Lennart Meri.
Linnamagi said the award was made for those companies who helped exports, bring new technology and create jobs.
Elcoteq manufactures products for the electronics manufacturing services industry from a factory in Tallinn.
It is Estonia's biggest exporter and has created more than 1,300 high tech related jobs in the country.
The Baltic investment conference, organised by London-based ICM marketing, has brought together corporate officials and bankers who are interested in or already have invested in the Baltic states.
